name: Natural Disaster
description: A natural cataclysm such as a wildfire, devastating weather, earthquake, or flood (as determined by the GM) devastates your kingdom. While in a worst-case scenario the disasterâ€™s immediate and most destructive effects affect a single settlement, many of its effects are larger in scope and can affect the entire kingdom.

criticalSuccess.msg: You prepared well for the disaster. While disruptive, the damage is minimized.

success.msg: Your quick response keeps your people safe and allows you to recover quickly. During the next turn, @lose4ResourceDiceNextTurn

failure.msg: The disaster causes severe damage. Choose one claimed hex in which you have a Farmland or Work Site; that feature is destroyed. @gain1Decay and @gain1d6Unrest. @lose6ResourceDiceNextTurn

criticalFailure.msg: Multiple hexes are totally devastated. Choose [[/r 1d6]] claimed hexes in which you have Farmlands or Work Sites; those features are destroyed. @gainMultiple1Decay for each hex affected, and @gain2d6Unrest. In addition, one settlement of your choice is particularly hard hit; that settlement immediately suffers the effects of a Local Disaster. @lose8ResourceDiceNextTurn
